It appears that the XML formatter used by the Ant JUnit task (correctly)
encodes any '<' or '>' characters that appear in the output of the test
method before including it in the XML output file.

For example, if in my test method I call
     fail("<b>big problem</b>");

then in the XML document, this will appear as:
     <testcase name=" ... " class=" ... ">
        <failure message="<b>big problem</b>" type=" ... ">
           ...
        </failure>
     </testcase>

Now, when the <junit-report> Ant task processes this file, it copies the
encoding over to the HTML document, so that when the report is viewed in 
a browser the <b> tag is just interpreted as regular text instead of markup.

Anyone know how to get markup from a JUnit test across to the output
from the <junit-reprot> task?

Thanks
